definition: to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Then you truly are a fool, Prince Frog.
sentences.chinese: 那你就着实是个傻瓜，青蛙王子。

sentences.english: But they are particularly common in the dismal science.
sentences.chinese: 但是在这个阴郁的学科领域里着实常见。

sentences.english: Students can get a lot from a video of a lecture given by a great teacher.
sentences.chinese: 通过名师的授课视频，学生们着实收获良多。

sentences.english: That feels really good and it changes us.
sentences.chinese: 那种感觉着实很棒，而且会改变我们。

sentences.english: I’m truly proud working for Nedbank.
sentences.chinese: 我着实以在南非莱利银行工作为荣。

sentences.english: Too hung, locust tree really surprised out in a cold sweat, thanks to the file didnt hand over to.
sentences.chinese: 太悬了，槐树着实惊出一身冷汗，多亏文件没交出去。

sentences.english: The furor over Greg's work breaks my heart.
sentences.chinese: 大家对葛瑞格工作的愤怒着实让我伤心。

sentences.english: Wang read, thought is truly understand.
sentences.chinese: 王冕看书，心想也着实明白了。

sentences.english: And there's a real sense that it isn't worth doing if it won't change the world.
sentences.chinese: 如果无法改变世界，那着实会有总徒劳无益的想法。

sentences.english: THE story of China Minsheng Bank ought to warm the heart.
sentences.chinese: 中国民生银行的历史着实鼓舞人心。

sentences.english: Our dreams, they feel real while were in them, right?
sentences.chinese: 我们做梦的时间，梦境是着实的，对纰谬？

sentences.english: The specialty capability that falls wild goose is a pastry, however, the vegetables doing is also really quite good.
sentences.chinese: 落雁的拿手本事是糕点，不过，做的菜也着实不错。

sentences.english: The dry river-going to bed finds no thanks for its past.
sentences.chinese: 干枯的河床，着实不感谢感动它的过往。

sentences.english: At supper time he was quite hungry , so he couldn't stand it any longer.
sentences.chinese: 晚餐时间到了，他着实是太饿了，他不能再忍下去了。

definition: indeed/truly/(coll.) (used to express disapproval, annoyance etc about sth)
contrary to what one might expect/actually/contrariwise/why don't you
to cause one (to do sth)/to make one (angry, delighted etc)
to speak the truth/truth to tell/frankly
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
